messages.content: What is the most significant basic scientific discovery of the 21st century, so far?

The most significant basic scientific discoveries of the 21st century, so far, are likely to be several discoveries that have been made in various fields of science, including physics, biology, and astronomy. The discovery of the Higgs boson particle was a major milestone in our understanding of the fundamental nature of matter and the universe, as it provided experimental evidence for the existence of the Higgs field, which is thought to be responsible for the mass of other particles.
2. The discovery of gravitational waves, which were first detected by the Laser Interferometer Gravitational-Wave Observatory (LIGO) in 2015. The discovery of gravitational waves provided evidence for the existence of gravitational waves, which are ripples in the fabric of spacetime that are generated by the collision of massive objects. This discovery has opened up a new field of study known as gravitational-wave astronomy, which has the potential to provide us with new insights into the universe.

This discovery has also led to the development of new techniques for studying exoplanets, which has the potential to provide us with new insights into the origins of life and the universe.
